title: Microservices Architecture Patterns
description: Deep dive into modern microservices patterns, including saga, CQRS, and event sourcing.
longDescription:
Join us for an in-depth exploration of microservices architecture patterns that are transforming how we build scalable applications. This session will cover practical implementation strategies, common pitfalls, and real-world case studies from large-scale systems.

We'll explore the Saga pattern for managing distributed transactions, Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS) for separating read and write operations, and Event Sourcing for maintaining application state through immutable event logs.

location.name: Warsaw University of Technology
location.directions: Metro: Nowy Świat-Uniwersytet station (2 min walk)
location.parking: Paid parking nearby, public transport recommended

speakers.name: Anna Kowalska
speakers.bio: Anna is a Principal Software Architect with over 12 years of experience designing large-scale distributed systems. She has led the architecture for several successful microservices transformations and is passionate about sharing knowledge with the community.

speakers.name: Piotr Nowicki
speakers.bio: Piotr specializes in Kubernetes orchestration and cloud-native architectures. He has implemented microservices platforms for Fortune 500 companies and is an active contributor to open-source projects.

speakers.name: Maria Wiśniewska
speakers.bio: Maria leads a team of 15 engineers building high-frequency trading systems. She has deep expertise in event sourcing and CQRS patterns in financial applications.

presentations.title: Saga Pattern: Managing Distributed Transactions
presentations.description: Deep dive into implementing saga patterns for complex business workflows across microservices, including choreography vs orchestration approaches.

presentations.title: Kubernetes Deployment Strategies for Microservices
presentations.description: Best practices for deploying and managing microservices in Kubernetes, covering service mesh, monitoring, and scaling strategies.

presentations.title: CQRS & Event Sourcing in High-Performance Systems
presentations.description: Real-world implementation of CQRS and Event Sourcing patterns in financial trading systems, handling millions of transactions per day.

agenda.title: Welcome & Networking
agenda.description: Grab a coffee and connect with fellow architects

agenda.title: Introduction to Microservices Patterns
agenda.speaker: Anna Kowalska
agenda.description: Overview of key patterns and when to use them

agenda.title: CQRS & Event Sourcing
agenda.speaker: Anna Kowalska
agenda.description: Separating reads and writes, maintaining state through events

title: Event-Driven Architecture in Practice
description: Real-world implementation of event-driven systems with Apache Kafka and event streaming.
longDescription: Explore how event-driven architecture can transform your application design and enable real-time data processing at scale. This session covered practical implementation strategies using Apache Kafka, event streaming patterns, and lessons learned from production systems.

speakers.name: Michał Nowak
speakers.bio: Michał is the CTO at StartupXYZ where he leads the technical vision for event-driven platforms. He has extensive experience with Kafka, event streaming, and building resilient distributed systems.

agenda.title: Event-Driven Architecture Fundamentals
agenda.speaker: Michał Nowak
agenda.description: Core concepts and benefits of event-driven systems

agenda.title: Apache Kafka in Production
agenda.speaker: Michał Nowak
agenda.description: Real-world Kafka implementation and best practices

agenda.title: Event Streaming Patterns
agenda.speaker: Michał Nowak
agenda.description: Common patterns and anti-patterns in event streaming

title: Domain-Driven Design Workshop
description: Hands-on workshop on applying DDD principles to complex business domains.
longDescription: A comprehensive hands-on workshop exploring Domain-Driven Design principles and their practical application in complex business scenarios. Participants worked through real-world examples, learned strategic and tactical DDD patterns, and practiced event storming techniques.

speakers.name: Katarzyna Wiśniewska
speakers.bio: Katarzyna specializes in domain modeling and has helped numerous organizations implement DDD successfully. She is a certified DDD practitioner and regular conference speaker.

agenda.title: DDD Strategic Patterns
agenda.speaker: Katarzyna Wiśniewska
agenda.description: Bounded contexts, ubiquitous language, and context mapping

agenda.title: Tactical DDD Patterns
agenda.speaker: Katarzyna Wiśniewska
agenda.description: Aggregates, entities, value objects, and domain services
